clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation of Venous Oxygen Saturation Measurements by Non-invasive Mespere Venous Oximeter and Central Venous Catheter
clinical_study.official_title: Correlation of Venous Oxygen Saturation Measurements by Non-invasive Mespere Venous Oximeter vs Venous Oxygen Saturation From Blood Samples From the External Jugular Vein vs Central Venous Oxygen Saturation (ScvO2) vs Mixed Venous Oxygen Saturation (SvO2), Measured by a CO-Oximeter.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to establish the accuracy of the non-invasive Mespere VA Oximeter that uses near infrared spectroscopy (NIRS) to estimate venous oxygen saturation. The VA Oximeter will be validated by comparing it to the analysis of blood samples from the external jugular vein, internal jugular vein, and pulmonary artery measurements via right heart catheter (RHC). Furthermore, cardiac output (CO) measured from the Mespere VA Oximeter using the jugular vein and finger pulse oximeter will be compared to CO typically measured in practice using the central line, finger pulse oximeter, and Fick's equation.

detailed_description.textblock:
The conventional pulse oximeter has been a standard in clinical care for non-invasive hemodynamic monitoring, which only measures arterial blood oxygenation. The clinical application of venous oximetry is numerous, including severe sepsis and septic shock, severe trauma and hemorrhagic shock, and heart failure and cardiac arrest.
The existing method for venous blood oxygenation monitored is either through an invasive fiber optic catheter, or intermittently by blood sampling and CO-Oximetry. However, catheterization can be costly and can include inherent risks. Therefore, due to the inherent risks of catheterization, venous oximetry is limited only to critically ill patients.
By non-invasively monitoring both venous and arterial blood oxygenation, Mespere VA Oximeter provides more complete information on patient hemodynamics and has clear advantages over conventional pulse oximeters.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: VA Oximeter ScvO2 Accuracy compared to CO-Oximeter
primary_outcome.description: Accuracy of venous oxygen saturation measurements by VA Oximeter vs direct measurement of blood samples using CO-Oximeter (Avoximeter 4000)

arm_group.description: Acute and chronic heart failure patients already receiving right heart catheterization (RHC) as part of their usual care

intervention.description: The Mespere VA Oximeter System is a novel non-invasive medical device for simultaneous measurement of venous blood oxygenation through the external jugular vein and arterial blood oxygenation through the finger tip (SpO2). The Mespere VA Oximeter is based upon near infrared spectroscopy. The System consists of a portable display unit and two sensor probes. The user interface simultaneously displays the measured arterial and venous oxygen saturation percentage, at a refresh rate of approximately one (1) second, and their respective plethysmographic waveforms.

The portable Avoximeter 4000 provides rapid, accurate assessment of the patient's true oxygenation status at the bedside. Features: Results in less than 10 seconds; No sample preparation required; Uses whole blood sample; Easy to use.

study_pop.textblock: Acute and chronic heart failure patients already receiving right heart catheterization (RHC) as part of their usual care

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 and older
- Heart failure patients already receiving RHC as part of their usual care
- Subject has visible left or right external jugular vein (EJV)
- Signed written and informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Lack of patient consent
- Subject is pregnant
- Evidence of abnormal neck anatomy
- Subject does not have visible left and right external jugular vein (EJV)
- Subject has occluded internal jugular veins under ultrasound imaging
- Allergic to adhesive tape
- Ongoing photodynamic therapy
- Presence of known anatomical shunt or AV dialysis fistula
- Known central vein stenosis
